BF.Ability.Constitution.Label: Constitution

BF.Ability.Intelligence.Label: Intelligence
BF.Ability.Wisdom.Label: Wisdom
BF.AbilityAssignment.Label: Determine Ability Scores
BF.AbilityAssignment.ScoringMethods.Hint: There are three methods to determine your starting ability scores. No method is “better” than another, but some people like one way more, so we include them to appeal to different kinds of players.
BF.AbilityAssignment.Method.Manual.Label: Manual Assignment
BF.AbilityAssignment.Method.Rolling.Hint: This is the classic, providing surprises and maybe a tough choice. It helps make a character you adapt to, instead of you making all the decisions.
BF.AbilityAssignment.Method.PointBuy.Hin: If you don’t want to leave it up to chance, you can assign ability scores with the point-buy method.
BF.AbilityAssignment.Method.StandardArra: To get started faster, use the standard array.
BF.AccentColor.Label: Accent Color
BF.Actor.Category.Person.Label: Person
BF.Advancement.Label: Advancement
BF.Advancement.Core.Title.Label: Custom Title
BF.Advancement.Core.Hint.Label: Hint
BF.Advancement.Core.Hint.Hint: Additional description to help player with required choice.
BF.Advancement.Core.Icon.Label: Custom Icon
BF.Advancement.Config.Title: Configure {item} Advancement
BF.Advancement.Config.DropHint: Drop Items here to add them to this advancement.
BF.Advancement.Config.AllowDrops.Label: Allow Drops
BF.Advancement.Config.AllowDrops.Hint: Should players be able to drop their own choices into this advancement?
BF.Advancement.Config.Warning.Duplicate: That item already exists on this advancement.
BF.Advancement.Config.Warning.Invalid: {type} items cannot be added with this advancement type.
BF.Advancement.Config.Warning.Recursive: You cannot grant an item in its own advancement.
BF.Advancement.Selection.Title: Select Advancement Type
BF.Advancement.ChooseFeatures.Title: Choose Features
BF.Advancement.ChooseFeatures.Hint: Present the player with a choice of features or talents that they can choose for their character at one or more levels.
BF.Advancement.ChooseFeatures.Choices.Hi: Specify how many choices are allowed at each level.
BF.Advancement.ChooseFeatures.Drop: Drop a {type} here to select it
BF.Advancement.ChooseFeatures.Type.Label: Item Type
BF.Advancement.ChooseFeatures.Warning.Pr: This feature has already been chosen at a previous level.
BF.Advancement.ChooseFeatures.Warning.Ty: Only {type} can be selected for this choice.
BF.Advancement.GrantFeatures.Title: Features
BF.Advancement.GrantFeatures.Hint: Grant the character features when they reach a certain level.
BF.Advancement.HitPoints.Title: Hit Points
BF.Advancement.HitPoints.Hint: Set an class's hit die size and track a player's hit points as they gain levels.
BF.Advancement.HitPoints.Notification: Hit points need to be increased
BF.Advancement.KeyAbility.Title: Key Ability
BF.Advancement.KeyAbility.Hint: Specify the key & secondary abilities on a class, giving the player an option if there is more than one, and granting the actor the appropriate saving throw proficiencies.
BF.Advancement.KeyAbility.Options.Label: Key Ability Options
BF.Advancement.KeyAbility.Options.Hint: Player can choose from one of these ability options as their key ability.
BF.Advancement.KeyAbility.Secondary.Hint: One secondary ability in which the player will also get a save proficiency.
BF.Advancement.Property.Title: Set Property
BF.Advancement.Property.Hint: Change one or more actor properties using a system similar to active effects.
BF.Advancement.Size.Title: Size
BF.Advancement.Size.Hint: Set a character's size or give them a choice of sizes.
BF.Advancement.Size.Options.Label: Size Options
BF.Advancement.Size.Options.Hint: Player can choose from any selected size. If only one is selected, then their character will become that size automatically.
BF.Advancement.Trait.Title: Traits
BF.Advancement.Trait.Hint: Grant a character certain traits of proficiencies or present them a choice.
BF.Advancement.Trait.Choice.Mode.Label: Choice Mode
BF.Advancement.Trait.Choice.Mode.Hint: Method by which the player is able to select from the choice sets.
BF.Advancement.Trait.Choice.Mode.Exclusi: Player can make a choice from only one set of choices.
BF.Advancement.Trait.Choice.Mode.Inclusi: Player will be able to choose from all available sets of choices.
BF.Advancement.Trait.Choices.Label: Choices
BF.Advancement.Trait.Choices.Hint: The following traits will be presented as a choice to the player.
BF.Advancement.Trait.Count.Label: Count
BF.Advancement.Trait.Guaranteed.Label: Guaranteed
BF.Advancement.Trait.Guaranteed.Hint: The following traits will be granted to the character.
BF.Advancement.Trait.Mode.Label: Mode
BF.Advancement.Trait.Mode.Default.Label: Default
BF.Advancement.Trait.Mode.Expertise.Hint: Gain expertise in a trait in which you already have proficiency.
BF.Advancement.Trait.Mode.Force.Label: Forced Expertise
BF.Advancement.Trait.Mode.Force.Hint: Gain expertise in a trait regardless of your previous proficiency level.
BF.Advancement.Trait.Mode.Upgrade.Label: Upgrade
BF.Advancement.Trait.Mode.Upgrade.Hint: Gain proficiency in a trait unless you already have it, otherwise gain expertise.
BF.Ammunition.Type.Label: Ammunition Type
BF.Armor.Modifier.Label: Modifier
BF.Armor.Modifier.Maximum.Label: Maximum Modifier
BF.Armor.Modifier.Minimum.Label: Minimum Modifier
BF.Armor.Notification.NotProficient: Using {type} without proficiency results in disadvantage on STR & DEX ability checks.
BF.Armor.Property.Cumbersome.Label: Cumbersome
BF.Armor.Property.NaturalMaterials.Label: Natural Materials
BF.Armor.Property.Noisy.Label: Noisy
BF.Armor.RequiredStrength.Label: Required Strength
BF.Armor.Value.Label: Armor Value
BF.ArmorClass.Label: Armor Class
BF.ArmorClass.Flat.Label: Flat Value
BF.ArmorClass.Flat.Hint: Arbitrary that is made available to AC formulas such as Natural Armor.
BF.ArmorClass.Override.Label: Override
BF.ArmorClass.Override.Hint: Value that will replace the calculated AC, preventing any other bonuses from applying.
BF.ConceptSelection.Title: Select {type}
BF.ConceptSelection.NoOptions: No {typePlural} could be found, create a {type} in the world or enabled a compendium containing {typePlural}.
BF.ConceptSelection.Warning.Duplicate: A {type} already exists on the actor {name}.
BF.ConceptSelection.Warning.InvalidType: Documents of the type {type} cannot be set using the setConcept method.
BF.Configuration.Title: {type} Configuration

BF.Damage.Label: Damage

BF.Die.Denomination.Label: Denomination

BF.Equipment.Base.Label: Base

BF.HitDie.Warning.NoneAvailableGeneric: No hit dice available to roll.
BF.HitDie.Warning.NoneAvailableSpecific: No d{denomination} hit dice available to roll.
BF.HitPoint.Damage.Label: Damage Taken
BF.Identifier.Label: Identifier
BF.Identifier.Hint: Simplified and non-localized version of name used for internal lookups.
BF.Identifier.Error.Invalid: Identifier can only contain letters (a-z), numbers (0-9), dashes (-), and underscores (_).

BF.Initiative.Ability.Label: Initiative Ability

BF.Item.Description.Label: Description

BF.Item.Feature.Type.Label: Feature Type
BF.Item.Journal.Label: Journal Entry
BF.Item.Journal.Hint: Link to a journal entry with an extended description of this item.
BF.Item.Source.Label: Source
BF.Item.Source.Hint: Source book or module where this item originated.
BF.Item.Talent.Category.Label: Talent Category
BF.JournalPage.Class.NoClass: No valid class selected, press the edit button to add a class.
BF.JournalPage.Class.Equipment.Hint: List of equipment granted by this class if taken at first level.
BF.JournalPage.Class.Features.Descriptio: As a {lowercaseName}, you gain the following class features.
BF.JournalPage.Class.HitPoints.Hint: Additional descriptive text displayed beneath the auto-generated hit points section.
BF.JournalPage.Class.HitPoints.Level1: Hit Points at 1st Level: {max} + your Constitution modifier
BF.JournalPage.Class.HitPoints.LevelX: Hit Points at Higher Levels: {dice} (or {average}) + your Constitution modifier per {class} level after 1st
BF.JournalPage.Class.Introduction.Label: Introduction
BF.JournalPage.Class.Introduction.Hint: Primary description of the class that will appear first.
BF.JournalPage.Class.Item.Label: Selected Class
BF.JournalPage.Class.Table.Caption: {class} Progression
BF.JournalPage.Class.Traits.Hint: Additional descriptive text displatyed beneeth list of proficiencies granted by this class.
BF.Level.Warning.Max: Character cannot be leveled up past {max}.
BF.Luck.Label: Luck
BF.Luck.Warning.OnlyOneReroll: Only a single re-roll is allowed.
BF.Modifier.Proficiency.Label: Prof?
BF.Movement.Label: Movement
BF.Prerequisite.Label: Prerequisite
BF.Prerequisite.Ability.Label: {abbreviation} Score of {value} or Higher
BF.Prerequisite.Ability.Title: Minimum Ability Scores
BF.Prerequisite.Ability.Warning: must have a {ability} of {value} or higher
BF.Prerequisite.Config.Title: Prerequisite Configuration
BF.Prerequisite.Spellcasting.Label: Ability to Cast Spells
BF.Prerequisite.Spellcasting.Warning: must be able to cast spells
BF.Prerequisite.SpellcastingDamage.Label: Ability to Cast at Least One Spell that Deals Damage
BF.Prerequisite.SpellcastingDamage.Warni: must be able to cast at least one spell that deals damage
BF.Prerequisite.Size.Label: {size} Size
BF.Price.Label: Price
BF.Proficiency.Bonus.Label: Proficiency Bonus
BF.Progression.Label: Progression
BF.Progression.Action.LevelDown.Label: Level Down
BF.Progression.Action.LevelDown.Title: Are you sure you would like to level down?
BF.Progression.Action.LevelDown.Message: Leveling down this character will remove any features granted and choices made during character progression.
BF.Progression.Action.LevelUp.Label: Level Up
BF.Quantity.Label: Quantity
BF.Range.Label: Range
BF.Range.Short.Label: Short
BF.Range.Long.Label: Long
BF.Reach.Label: Reach
BF.Rest.Label: Resting
BF.Rest.Action.Rest.Label: Rest
BF.Rest.Result.Long.Full: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {hitPoints} {hitPointsLabel} and {hitDice} {hitDiceLabel}.
BF.Rest.Result.Long.HitDice: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {hitDice} {hitDiceLabel}.
BF.Rest.Result.Long.HitPoints: {name} takes a long rest and recovers {hitPoints} {hitPointsLabel}.
BF.Rest.Result.Short.Full: {name} takes a short rest and spends {hitDice} {hitDiceLabel} to recover {hitPoints} {hitPointsLabel}.
BF.Rest.Type.Long.Label: Long Rest
BF.Rest.Type.Long.Hint: At the end of a long rest, you regain all lost hit points. You also regain spent hit dice, up to half of your maximum (minimum of 1).
BF.Rest.Type.Short.Label: Short Rest
BF.Rest.Type.Short.Hint: You can spend one or more hit dice at the end of a short rest, up to your maximum number of hit dice.

BF.Settings.AbilitySelectionManual.Label: Allow Manual Ability Assignments
BF.Settings.AbilitySelectionManual.Hint: Allow players to manually set their ability scores rather than using the standard selection methods.
BF.Settings.AbilitySelectionReroll.Label: Allow Re-rolls on Ability Scores
BF.Settings.AbilitySelectionReroll.Hint: Allow players to re-roll when using the rolling ability score selection method.
BF.Settings.InitiativeTiebreaker.Label: Initiative Tiebreaker
BF.Settings.InitiativeTiebreaker.Hint: Add initiative ability score as decimal to help break ties in initiatives.
BF.Settings.ProficiencyMode.Label: Proficiency Variant
BF.Settings.ProficiencyMode.Hint: Configure proficiency modifier to use a fixed bonus or a dice roll.
